privacy.title: Privacy Policy
privacy.subtitle: Personal Information Protection Policy
privacy.introduction: BonZuttner Inc. (hereinafter referred to as 'the Company') establishes the following Privacy Policy (hereinafter referred to as 'this Policy') regarding the handling of users' personal information in the services provided on this website (hereinafter referred to as 'this Service').

article1.title: Article 1 (Personal Information)
article1.content: 'Personal Information' refers to 'personal information' as defined in the Personal Information Protection Act, and refers to information about living individuals that can identify specific individuals through names, dates of birth, addresses, telephone numbers, contact information and other descriptions contained in such information, as well as data relating to appearance, fingerprints, voiceprints, and information that can identify specific individuals from such information alone (personal identification information).

article2.title: Article 2 (Collection Method of Personal Information)
article2.content: The Company may ask for personal information such as name, date of birth, address, telephone number, email address, bank account number, credit card number, driver's license number, etc. when users register for use. In addition, transaction records and payment information containing users' personal information made between users and partners may be collected from the Company's partners (including information providers, advertisers, advertisement distributors, etc., hereinafter referred to as 'Partners').

article3.title: Article 3 (Purpose of Collecting and Using Personal Information)
article3.intro: The purposes for which the Company collects and uses personal information are as follows:
article3.items:
1. To provide and operate the Company's services
2. To respond to inquiries from users (including identity verification)
3. To send emails about new features, updates, campaigns, etc. of services being used by users and other services provided by the Company
4. For necessary contact such as maintenance and important notices
5. To identify users who violate the terms of use or attempt to use services for fraudulent or improper purposes and refuse their use
6. To allow users to view, change, delete their registration information and view their usage status
7. To bill users for usage fees in paid services
8. Purposes incidental to the above usage purposes

article4.title: Article 4 (Change of Purpose of Use)
article4.content:
1. The Company shall change the purpose of use of personal information only when it is reasonably recognized that the purpose of use is related to the purpose before the change.
2. When the purpose of use is changed, the Company shall notify users of the changed purpose by the method prescribed by the Company or publish it on this website.

article5.title: Article 5 (Provision of Personal Information to Third Parties)
article5.intro: 1. The Company will not provide personal information to third parties without obtaining prior consent from users, except in the following cases. However, this excludes cases permitted by the Personal Information Protection Act and other laws.
article5.items:
a. When it is necessary for the protection of human life, body or property and it is difficult to obtain the consent of the person
b. When it is particularly necessary for improving public health or promoting the sound development of children and it is difficult to obtain the consent of the person
c. When it is necessary to cooperate with national institutions, local governments, or their commissioned parties in carrying out affairs stipulated by laws and regulations, and obtaining the consent of the person may hinder the performance of such affairs
d. When the following matters are notified or published in advance and the Company has reported to the Personal Information Protection Commission
article5.conclusion: 2. Notwithstanding the provisions of the preceding paragraph, in the following cases, the recipient of such information shall not be considered a third party.
article5.exceptions:
a. When the Company entrusts all or part of the handling of personal information within the scope necessary to achieve the purpose of use
b. When personal information is provided in connection with business succession due to merger or other reasons
c. When personal information is jointly used with specific parties, and the fact, the items of personal information to be jointly used, the scope of joint users, the purpose of use by the users, and the name or title of the person responsible for managing the personal information are notified to the person in advance or made easily accessible to the person

article6.title: Article 6 (Disclosure of Personal Information)
article6.content:
1. When requested by the person to disclose personal information, the Company will disclose it to the person without delay. However, if disclosure would fall under any of the following cases, all or part of it may not be disclosed, and if a decision is made not to disclose, the person will be notified without delay.
2. Notwithstanding the provisions of the preceding paragraph, information other than personal information such as history information and characteristic information will not be disclosed in principle.

article7.title: Article 7 (Correction and Deletion of Personal Information)
article7.content:
1. If the personal information held by the Company about the user is incorrect, the user may request the Company to correct, add or delete the personal information (hereinafter referred to as 'correction, etc.') according to the procedures established by the Company.
2. When the Company receives a request from a user under the preceding paragraph and determines that it is necessary to respond to the request, it shall make corrections, etc. to the personal information without delay.
3. When the Company makes corrections, etc. based on the provisions of the preceding paragraph, or when it decides not to make corrections, etc., it shall notify the user without delay.

article8.title: Article 8 (Suspension of Use of Personal Information)
article8.content:
1. When the Company is requested by the person to suspend or delete the use of personal information (hereinafter referred to as 'suspension of use, etc.') on the grounds that the personal information is being handled beyond the scope of the purpose of use or was obtained by fraudulent means, the Company will conduct necessary investigations without delay.
2. Based on the results of the investigation in the preceding paragraph, if it is determined that it is necessary to respond to the request, the Company will suspend the use of the personal information without delay.
3. When the Company suspends the use, etc. based on the provisions of the preceding paragraph, or when it decides not to suspend the use, etc., it shall notify the user without delay.
4. Notwithstanding the preceding two paragraphs, if suspension of use, etc. involves significant costs or is otherwise difficult to implement, and alternative measures necessary to protect the user's rights and interests can be taken, such alternative measures shall be implemented.

article9.title: Article 9 (Changes to Privacy Policy)
article9.content:
1. The contents of this Policy may be changed without notifying users, except for matters otherwise specified in laws and regulations and this Policy.
2. Except when otherwise determined by the Company, the changed Privacy Policy shall take effect from the time it is posted on this website.

hero.title: Story
hero.subtitle: ~This company has a worldview that even refugees can enjoy living in~
hero.subtitleEn: This company has a worldview that even refugees can enjoy living in.
hero.content:
What images come to mind when you hear the word 'refugee'?
Many Japanese people probably think of negative words such as 'miserable', 'pitiful', and 'difficult'.
However, we at BonZuttner think positively,
and they are 'individual human beings' who, like us, each have different names, personalities, hobbies, and special skills.
People cannot choose the country they are born in or the environment they grow up in.
They are human beings who must live just like us, only differing in the country they were born in and the environment they grew up in.
We at BonZuttner shake off those preconceptions and are a
'social business' company where even refugees can live and work happily.
Our business model does not engage in businesses where profitability and sociality conflict,
but is a business model that prioritizes solving social problems.
'Creating new value from the energetic spirit that can run around the world'
From the thoughts hidden in our logo, we will continue to deliver a worldview where even refugees can live happily
from this BonZuttner to everyone.

companyOrigin.title: COMPANY ORIGIN
companyOrigin.nameOrigin:
'Bon' (French for good, excellent, well-made) 
 'Zutt' (Japanese for always, continuously) 
 'Er' (English for person who does something)
companyOrigin.meaning:
A person who continues to strive to be good, 
 and acts accordingly
companyOrigin.description:
The company name is derived from 'Bertha von Suttner'. She was the first woman to receive the Nobel Peace Prize, and as a symbol of the concept of 'peace', we pay our respects to her and borrowed her name to name our company 'BonZuttner'.
Even in the real world where there are various conflicts and obstacles, we as a social business company value 'peace of mind', and refugees and displaced persons should not lose their professional skills and earning power as human beings, nor should their identity and core of life be destroyed.
We maintain a positive attitude, firmly nurture our moral and ethical values, always maintain the attitude of trying to become good people, and aim to solve 'social problems'.

concept.title: CONCEPT
concept.subtitle: Breaking down refugee barriers through universal language
concept.heading: Human resources that Japan can be proud of to the world.
concept.description:
We at BonZuttner aim to discover and solve our customers' business issues through the power of WEB/IT, while also contributing to solving refugee problems. 
 Technologies such as WEB/IT including programming and blockchain are universal languages, 
 and we want our customers to feel firsthand that our engineers with refugee backgrounds also possess world-class technology. 
 Since our colleagues want to contribute to Syrian reconstruction through business, 
 we are a company specializing in Middle Eastern IT engineers, led by Syrians, and we sincerely work with our customers to bring about a better future for them. 
 Since we actually participate in meetings and discussions with Japanese clients and perform a wide range of tasks from upstream to downstream processes, we would like you to experience not only WEB/IT technology but also refugee experiences and empowerment, and communicate with us as 'individual human beings'.

purposeStatement.title: PURPOSE STATEMENT
purposeStatement.heading: Three 'Re.'
purposeStatement.rebuildDesc: Rebuild: Reconstructing new life, environment, and connections
purposeStatement.restartDesc: Restart: After Rebuild and Recreate, towards a new start.
purposeStatement.mission: To remove the label of 'refugee' and become a company where everyone can recognize each other, in order to bring out the diversity of society.
purposeStatement.description:
We are not refugees, but Returnees, Rebuilders, Recreators and Restarters. 
 In Japanese translation, this is expressed as 'those who travel' aiming for 'reconstruction', 'recreation', and 'restart'. 
 There are constant changes in the world, and it's not just our society that undergoes metabolism. 
 The same is true for refugees. 
 We at BonZuttner keep this feeling in our hearts, 
 and sincerely face our customers.

theFuture.title: THE FUTURE
theFuture.motto:
To be able to hold hands,
 look forward,
 and gaze into the light.
theFuture.description:
What we at BonZuttner aim for is to become 'beings who can hold hands, look forward, and gaze into the light'.
 Whether refugees or Japanese, as human beings, we are a company that aims to create a society where people can equally enjoy minimum rights and life, and to save those who are in the midst of suffering. We continue to grow constantly, have a sense of ownership and professionalism, and aim to be a company that can be happy with everyone by staying close to all people involved, including staff, customers, and those who watch us.

section2.title: The world is vast. That's why, dive in even more!!
section2.content:
When you travel, you encounter landscapes you've never seen, languages you've never heard, and cultures you've never touched.
Don't you feel excited when you step into an unknown world?
BonZuttner seeks people with such curiosity and action.
Our goal is to transform refugee issues into 'social assets'.
To transcend differences in nationality and culture and create new value.
It's okay if you don't speak English. What matters is the pure desire to 'know the unknown world'.
People who enjoy encountering different cultures, who can enjoy meeting people while traveling abroad.
Your sensibility will create BonZuttner's future.
Not because they're refugees, not because they're foreigners, not because their culture is different.
Rather than drawing such lines, we want to meet people who can interact with anyone on equal terms and face them as companions to create the future together.
Come on, let's enjoy the world more. Let's take a step forward with BonZuttner.

hero.title: Members
hero.subtitle: Member Introduction
hero.heading: A team that creates new value through diverse backgrounds.
hero.description: BonZuttner brings together members who share a common desire to 'pursue dreams, enjoy daily life, and contribute to society,' even though they come from different countries and environments. We introduce our colleagues who laugh, learn, and continue to grow together despite having various backgrounds.

message.title: Not as refugees, but as colleagues. The challenge to change the world.
message.content:
The background to my founding this company stems from the reality I witnessed through volunteer refugee support work. Amid the economic crisis caused by the Syrian civil war, many people with high IT skills were unable to find work opportunities and were receiving unfairly low wages.

However, their skills are world-class.

Properly evaluating this talent and creating an environment where they can work with pride. And creating a system where they can contribute to society while helping the next generation of colleagues. With these thoughts in mind, I established BonZuttner in 2019.

"Refugee" is just a label. To me, they are friends, neighbors, and colleagues who create the future together. Regardless of cultural or national differences, I want to create a place where we can respect each other and grow together.

BonZuttner is a company that focuses on system development while tackling social issues. We will continue to create new services for the future and aim to be a bridge to solving social challenges including refugee issues.

If you sympathize with our thoughts and want to jump into a new world. If you want to enjoy different cultures while taking on challenges together. Please join us as a colleague at BonZuttner to create the future together.

mission.title: MISSION
mission.subTitle: Turning 'refugee issues' into 'social assets'.

vision.content: BonZuttner creates a new future beyond countries and cultures through technology and human power. We aim to realize a society where diverse talents can thrive without being bound by the label of 'refugee', making the world richer and more interesting.

We also build an environment where we can grow in flat relationships while respecting each other, creating the future by maximizing the power of technology and opening up new possibilities with a global mindset that embraces diversity.

Header.title: BonZuttner Work History
Header.subtitle: Innovative solutions crafted with modern technologies

about.title: Our service creates the <highlight>AI</highlight> and <bold>Human</bold> “just right relationship.”
about.description: AI is already working in every aspect of our society: from banking, logistics, and café ordering to creating sales documents and supporting investment activities. The speed of AI and digital tool evolution is astonishingly fast, with new tools and acronyms appearing one after another—making it challenging to explore and use them properly. Many people still say: “AI and digital tools seem convenient, but I don’t know how to use them.” For such companies and organizations, we act as 'interpreters' of AI, making difficult technology easy to understand and usable in practice, supporting adoption until it takes root. By walking alongside managers and frontline staff until they can use AI and digital tools without hesitation, we don’t just deliver deliverables—we help employees build the capability to run operations themselves.

step1.title: Hearing
step1.content: To visualize the current situation and issues in a short period, we align goals, KPIs, target tasks, and constraints (Non-Goals), and decide where to start.

step2.title: Creating the Accompaniment Plan
step2.content: We design the To-Be state, define exit criteria numerically through trials, and put them into a roadmap. Then we reach mutual agreement on the goals and the approach.

step3.title: Execution Phase
step3.content: We prioritize existing tools and repeat short cycles of introduction, trial, and improvement. By reviewing KPIs, we visualize the effects, and develop standard templates, operation rules, dashboards, etc.

step4.title: Self-sustaining Operation
step4.content: We review the status of operations, prepare operation methods and transfer checklists required for expansion. After handing over to internal staff and confirming that the site can continue improving independently, our accompaniment ends.

section2.title: We are a “bridge team” between AI and humans
section2.content1: Our job is not simply to “introduce AI,” but to firmly embed it into everyday life and business activities in a truly valuable way.
section2.content2: We don’t just showcase the latest trends and technologies; we digest them and shape them into practical steps companies can take. We run alongside you as partners.
section2.content3: Perhaps we may spend more time thinking together about “what really matters” than writing code. But that is the future we choose.

caseStudies.title: 3 Cases Where Companies Struggle With AI Introduction

case1.title: AI was introduced, but we don’t know how to operate it.
case1.content: Most failures are due to choosing the wrong application areas. At BonZuttner, we visualize business processes and limit AI to processes where it excels. Together with clients, we identify current As-Is processes, select applicable areas, and define operation rules. We accompany you through capability → KPI → deliverables until operations run smoothly.

case2.title: We are worried because of resistance from frontline staff.
case2.content: Resistance often comes from changes in work style, evaluation, and authority. At BonZuttner, we define Non-Goals and clarify roles and responsibilities, improving productivity and quality. We prioritize frontline workers, creating systems with templates, rules, and reviews that can be continuously used.

case3.title: We don’t know how to choose AI tools.
case3.content: Companies often fall into this when they start with functions instead of purpose, or try to solve current issues without changing workflows. At BonZuttner, we first clarify the purpose and then select tools with the client to fulfill the To-Be state. Since we also develop systems, we can propose solutions that match the client’s budget.

relationship.title1: Bringing the “just right relationship” with AI to the workplace.
relationship.title2: We act as 'interpreters' to build systems that leave results behind.
relationship.content1: It’s extremely difficult for every company to keep up with the speed of AI evolution: new tools, cryptic acronyms, and endless updates.
relationship.content2: To those saying “I’m tired of chasing it all…” we become the 'interpreter.' We break down the latest AI tools and transform them into forms truly usable in practice. Sometimes we worry together, sometimes we say with a grin “this is how you should do it.” We fill the gap between companies and AI, building systems that create lasting results.

services.title: What BonZuttner Can Solve
services.subtitle: At BonZuttner, we focus on accompaniment-style AX/DX support, helping companies solve problems with a wide range of services. AX means 'AI Transformation'—the implementation and embedding of automation using AI. We provide a system that ensures even companies without AI or DX literacy can use our services with confidence.

service2.title: Business Digitalization (DX) Accompaniment Support
service2.description1: Planning the digitalization of analog tasks
service2.description2: Tool introduction, setup, and usage training tailored to your site
service2.description3: Support for creating internal rules and operation manuals for tool adoption

service3.title: Data Utilization & Analysis Support
service3.description2: Proposals and execution support for business improvement using analysis results
service3.description3: System development support for dashboards and tools to manage and utilize data

service4.title: IoT & On-site Improvement Support
service4.description1: Connecting sensors and equipment to networks to improve efficiency
service4.description2: Building systems for remote monitoring and automated alerts
service4.description3: Operational support in close partnership with on-site staff

section5.title1: Even if you are at the stage of “AI seems necessary, but where to start?”, it’s okay.
section5.content: Let’s review the current situation together and decide on the best first step for your company. We offer free consultations.

q1.question: Q1: Which tasks are suited for AI?
q1.answer: Tasks that are 'high frequency,' 'rule-based,' and have 'clear completion definitions' are ideal for AI. To achieve both effectiveness and reproducibility, it’s best to start with standardized knowledge and easily evaluated tasks.

q2.question: Q2: How do you ensure the handling of confidential information?
q2.answer: By defining data classification, minimum access rights, and operation logs beforehand, safe operation is possible. Without rules, later governance becomes very difficult.

q3.question: Q3: Can we start operations even if our data is incomplete?
q3.answer: Yes. You can start with text-based tasks while structuring progresses in parallel. You don’t need to wait for a DWH setup. For many companies, initial results can be achieved just from existing manuals and text data.

q4.question: Q4: What are the typical timelines and costs?
q4.answer: Since optimal scale differs per project, we propose the shortest path to adoption when creating the accompaniment plan. Costs vary depending on scope and whether new development is required. Please feel free to contact us.

q5.question: Q5: Is in-house development necessary?
q5.answer: To avoid excessive costs, we may perform minimal development when there are gaps with existing tools. We also compare third-party tools to propose solutions that clients can be satisfied with.
